intro: Polhillia involucrata, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, creating a showy display. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
